definition: a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: The fairy as the light of escape fish, play with us!
sentences.chinese: 這漏網之魚般的光的精靈，和我們一起遊戲。

sentences.english: The police arrested most of the gangsters, but there were stell stragglers.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了大部分的歹徒，但仍有漏網之魚。

sentences.english: This lets you spot any structures you may have overlooked in the corners of the map.
sentences.chinese: 這可以讓你看到任何你沒看過的角落是否有漏網之魚。

definition: lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: on call/always available/ready at all times
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to be reluctant to give up a post
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
